Replace.Text: Howitzers fire projectiles at relatively high trajectories, with a steep angle of descent, making them usefull against fortified positions and cities defense, while allowing indirect fire above obstacle. Their HE ammo give them a bonus against infantry units.
Field Guns fire smaller shells with higher velocities and flatter trajectories than Howitzers. Combined with armor-piercing ammo they can inflict great casualties on armor units.
Anti-Aircraft Artillery are guns with a high muzzle velocity – allowing the projectiles to reach greater altitudes – and a high rate of fire, that can also be used defensively against armor units.
Aircraft specialized in bombarding enemy targets. Strong against Cities, they lack precision when bombing Units.
The Galleon is the first ranged naval unit that can enter ocean.
The Galleon is the first ranged naval unit that can enter ocean.
Long range and well armed bombers with large payload that can deal a lot of damage to cities, but very imprecise against units.
Light aircrafts used for ground attack, they have a short range and are weak to enemy fighters, but they are your best choice to safely take out enemy armored vehicules.
Large and heavy armored tanks, they are very strong but slow and their size make them easy target for air attacks.
Light armored and fast moving tanks, good for scouting.
Smaller than Battleships but larger than Destroyers, Cruisers have a well balanced combination of speed, range and firepower.
The dreadnought was the first type of battleship with an "all-big-gun" armament scheme and steam turbine propulsion.
Siege unit between Cannon and Artillery.
